item.title: Singaporean businesses are feeling more optimistic than those in Hong Kong and are enjoying a superior work-life balance
item.description:
While 43% of businesses in Singapore are very confident about their growth prospects this year, only 30% of businesses in Hong Kong share the same level of confidence. This year, 61% of businesses in Singapore have plans to increase their workforce, whereas only 44% in Hong Kong intend to do so. A recent report called the Compass Index, which analyzed business trends in Hong Kong and Singapore, reveals a more optimistic outlook among businesses in Singapore, with employees experiencing a better work-life balance than their counterparts in Hong Kong...

item.title: Investors are increasingly optimistic about placing foreign direct investment in Singapore
item.description:
Singapore achieved a top-ten ranking in the 2016 AT Kearney Foreign Direct Investment (FDI) Confidence Index. The city-state climbed five positions, representing the most significant advancement in the rankings, securing the 10th spot. This index provides a future-oriented assessment of how political, economic, and regulatory shifts are likely to influence FDI inflows into various countries in the coming years. Since its inception in 1998, the study has consistently identified the preferred global destinations for FDI, with the index rankings closely mirroring actual global FDI inflows...

item.title: According to a global survey by YouGov, body confidence increases with age
item.description:
A recent global survey by YouGov revealed that most adults feel content with their weight and body image, and this satisfaction generally increases with age. However, the survey also highlighted a widespread concern that celebrity culture negatively impacts young people’s body image across almost all countries surveyed. The survey, spanning the US, Australia, and most of Europe and the Asia Pacific region, found that older individuals are considerably more likely to feel satisfied with their bodies compared to those in their twenties and thirties...
